ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Kaesora
ygData.msgSnippet: If the bard uses lev, you can get your group up to the exit of Kaesora, then work your way down. My first trip into the dungeon was nasty.  An enchanter friend
ygData.messageBody:
If the bard uses lev, you can get your group up to the exit of Kaesora, then
work your way down.

My first trip into the dungeon was nasty. An enchanter friend went down the
drop in the middle and got slaughtered by at least 5 spiders. I decided to
help with CR, and thought I could lev down, any maybe avoid the spiders. I
was wrong :(

So a rogue came to help with CR. We decided to lev him, and then after the
pulse, he'd go hide/sneak, and I'd turn off song, so he could float down.
That didn't work either.

Now we've got 1 level 40, and 2 level 45 corpses that seem irretreivable.
We were all afraid to jump down the pit again, and we realized that with
levitate, I could get us up to the exit ramp, and then we worked our way
down (with a bigger, higher level group). If it weren't for guild help, I'm
convinced my corpse would still be there, rotting away today.

Bien - Karana

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Robert Maze [SMTP:rmaze@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, May 30, 2000 2:42 PM
> To: Eqbards@...
> Subject: [eqbards] Kaesora
>
> Well I saw you mention Kaesora in a previous post Sylly and I thought I
> would give the list my experiences from there. My guild and I have pretty
> much lived there for the last 3 weeks or so. We have went to every part
> of
> this dungeon and killed every mob there. If you are in the high 30's to
> low
> 40's, it is an outstanding place to hunt. For a while we were the only
> groups there. There have been a few more people showing up lately, but it
> is still under utilized in my opinion. There are several named mobs in
> here
> which drop some good loot for the level range. Nearly everyone in the
> guild, 21 people, have gotten a dusty ransacker's pack. A couple of the
> books, a nice 2h slashing weapon, warrior only piercer, and several of the
> bard only piercers. So the loot is very well flowing. If you plan on
> going
> to the church, bring two groups, if you are in the 40's, and DO NOT use
> pets. We were there last week, very well balanced groups that included
> two
> necros and a shaman using pets. Well everything went well, after I died 3
> times (another long story that I shan't go into now :)) and we made our
> way
> down to the church. We started pulling 2's and 3's, no problem with the
> best enchanter on Veeshan IMHO, and we were going through them like candy.
>
> Now the fun starts. Out of nowhere we had 7 spiders on us. Mind you
> there
> are no spiders down near the church. We kill them and finish clearing the
> church. We go in and set up camp in the basement. We have a few pops,
> kill
> them, have a few more, kill them, get some roamers, etc. Then it
> happened.
> A pet disappears. A spider comes, and another, and another and so forth
> and
> so on. When we finally rest, we have killed over 35 mobs in a row. They
> just kept flooding the place. Very very scary being that far in a dungeon
> with that many mobs. We decide to head out and we go up into the church
> and
> the entire, I think, dungeon runs up on top of us including the named mob
> Xalgoz or something like that. Well I am the first one to die, and then
> seven more guildmates die, one person went LD, and 6 more evac out.
> Needless to say it wasn't pretty on the corpse recovery. Fun was had by
> all
> though.
>
> We went back the next day with no pets, and we had no freaky aggro. The
> only things that aggroed us were intentional.
>
> So in conclusion, if you are in the range of levels I stated above, grab
> your guild/group/friends and head down there. Pick up a map though,
> because
> you can't get out of the dungeon the way you come in. You go in and out
> of
> the same zone line, but you can't go up where you drop down from. Very
> cryptic, but it makes it that much more dangerous.
>
> Kurik Nitesong
> 40th bard, Veeshan
> "Only the Brave"
> ___________________
> Robert Maze
>
> robert@...
> www.fncinc.com
>
>
>
>
